titleStmt.title: A Looking-glass for King-opposers, or, Twenty admirable examples of Gods severe justice and displeasure against the subscribers of the late engagement against our lawfull soveraign King Charles the II and the whole House of Peers : in these words, I do declare and promise that I will be true and faithfull to the Commonwealth of England ... also against some of the judges of the late King in the high court of injustice.

A Looking-glass for King-opposers, or, Twenty admirable examples of Gods severe justice and displeasure against the subscribers of the late engagement against our lawfull soveraign King Charles the II and the whole House of Peers : in these words, I do declare and promise that I will be true and faithfull to the Commonwealth of England ... also against some of the judges of the late King in the high court of injustice.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
